title.value: Importance-aware Co-teaching for Offline Model-based Optimization
title.justification: The value is the same as the title found in the paper.
title.quote: Importance-aware Co-teaching for Offline Model-based Optimization

extractions.description: This paper introduces a method called Importance-aware Co-Teaching (ICT) to address the out-of-distribution issue in offline model-based optimization problems. The method employs a two-step approach: pseudo-label-driven co-teaching for generating pseudo-labeled data and meta-learning-based sample reweighting for improving accuracy. ICT is proven to achieve state-of-the-art results in various design-bench tasks.

type.justification: The paper involves conducting experiments and presenting empirical results showcasing the performance of ICT on various tasks.
type.quote: Through extensive experiments across various tasks [1], ICT proves effective at mitigating out-of-distribution issues, delivering state-of-the-art results.

name.justification: The study focuses on improving the accuracy and robustness of model-based optimization methods.
name.quote: Offline model-based optimization aims to find a design that maximizes a property of interest using only an offline dataset.

name.justification: The study employs meta-learning in the reweighting phase of the proposed method.
name.quote: To further improve accuracy of pseudo-labels, we perform a secondary step of meta-learning-based sample reweighting.

name.justification: The primary method proposed in the study is based on co-teaching principles.
name.quote: In the pseudo-label-driven co-teaching step, a proxy is iteratively chosen as the pseudo-labeler, initiating a co-teaching process that facilitates knowledge exchange between the other two proxies.

name.justification: The research addresses optimization using offline datasets.
name.quote: Offline model-based optimization aims to find a design that maximizes a property of interest using only an offline dataset.

name.justification: Superconductor is one of the datasets used for experiments.
name.quote: Dataset and Tasks. The continuous tasks include: (a) Superconductor (SuperC)[5], where the objective is to develop a superconductor with 86 continuous components to maximize critical temperature, using 17, 010 designs;

referenced_paper_title.value: A data-driven statistical model for predicting the critical temperature of a superconductor
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper for the Superconductor dataset.

name.justification: Ant Morphology is another dataset used for experiments.
name.quote: Dataset and Tasks. The continuous tasks include: (b) Ant Morphology (Ant)[1, 14], where the aim is to design a quadrupedal ant with 60 continuous components to improve crawling speed, based on 10, 004 designs;

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is one of the referenced papers for the Ant Morphology dataset.

name.justification: D'Kitty Morphology is a dataset used for experiments.
name.quote: Dataset and Tasks. The continuous tasks include: (c) D’Kitty Morphology (D’Kitty)[1, 15], where the focus is on shaping a quadrupedal D’Kitty with 56 continuous components to enhance crawling speed, using 10, 004 designs;

referenced_paper_title.value: Robel: Robotics benchmarks for learning with low-cost robots
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is one of the referenced papers for the D'Kitty Morphology dataset.

name.justification: Hopper Controller is a dataset used for experiments.
name.quote: Dataset and Tasks. The continuous tasks include: (d) Hopper Controller (Hopper)[1], where the aim is to identify a neural network policy with 5, 126 weights to optimize return, using 3, 200 designs.

referenced_paper_title.value: Design-Bench: Benchmarks for Data-Driven Offline Model-Based Optimization
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper for the Hopper Controller dataset.

name.justification: TF Bind 8 is a dataset used for experiments.
name.quote: Additionally, our discrete tasks include: (e) TF Bind 8 (TF8)[6], where the goal is to discover an 8-unit DNA sequence that maximizes binding activity score, utilizing 32, 898 designs;

referenced_paper_title.value: Survey of variation in human transcription factors reveals prevalent dna binding changes
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper for the TF Bind 8 dataset.

name.justification: TF Bind 10 is a dataset used for experiments.
name.quote: Additionally, our discrete tasks include: (f) TF Bind 10 (TF10)[6], where the aim is to find a 10-unit DNA sequence that optimizes binding activity score, using 50, 000 designs;

referenced_paper_title.value: Survey of variation in human transcription factors reveals prevalent dna binding changes
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper for the TF Bind 10 dataset.

name.justification: NAS is another dataset used for experiments.
name.quote: Additionally, our discrete tasks include: (g) NAS [16], where the objective is to find the optimal neural network architecture to enhance test accuracy on the CIFAR-10 [17] dataset, using 1, 771 designs.

referenced_paper_title.value: Neural architecture search with reinforcement learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is one of the referenced papers for the NAS dataset.
